html:
12.1.20  12:36 pm   BILL WHEN WILL YOUR NEW SONG COME OUT

      pretty soon

12.1.20  11:32 am   In the reality section of the website, at the oldest entry after selecting "i don't know" at the password screen, what was with the stacking of the books and such?

      that looks like a person who is absolutely desperate to make videos

12.1.20  10:22 am   if you wouldn't mind temporarily stepping out of the mindset of producing your newest and soon-too-be-hopefully-greatest song and video, is there any song you've made in the past that stands out to you in any way; 

     yes

     and if so, would you have any thoughts you could share?

      on 'hallelujah', i decided to START the entire recording process on an EQ setting that mimics the speaker on a smartphone. the reason i did this was to try to have a better guarantee that the arrangement would make sense there (literally no bass). it sometimes stresses me out that that platform is so drastically different from the ones that include the bass (headphones, car speakers, etc). It's almost like if you are doing a TV show and 40% of your audience can't see the color green. If you are making the project on a system where you CAN see the color green, you're gonna have no idea what those greenless viewers are even seeing. Some people check different systems at the very end, and then make 'adjustments', but i figured it's way too late if you check it at the end. so i decided to start the entire process in the bassless mode, to make sure i was making decisions that were strong on that platform. Then turn the bass frequencies back on and then fill in the bass i want for the full-range listeners. This seemed like a good idea but it didn't really go so well and i don't do it anymore. it didn't really harm the sound of the song, but it encouraged me to overthink even more than i normally do

12.1.20  9:06 am   Is life secretly weird

      yes, but there is an even bigger secret, that it's normal

12.1.20  9:01 am   How much of what you learned with these new methods will you be implementing into the music video?

     about 32%

     Do you exactly know yet?

     no

12.1.20  8:33 am   what is a country?

      i'm not sure

12.1.20  7:09 am   how to make music without knowing anything about it?

      it might be easier. no matter how much you 'know' about it, there is infinite times more unknown about it. that's because music is limitless. So, if you think you 'know' some things about it, it might be tempting to think your knowledge is worth something. when actually, no matter how much anyone knows, that still only represents around 0.0000% of the overal potential music knowledge base

12.1.20  6:08 am   what is your thought process when making your music?

     mostly thinking about how i feel. but, that actually doesn't work until i can reverse it. feeling about how i think

     do you just start with a single random note or beat

     usually the starting point has closer to 50/50 balance between musical and linguistic elements. otherwise it probably won't go so smoothly

     and go with the flow or do you think hard before making a song?

     think easy. the hardest thing about songwriting is it's too easy. sometimes it's very hard to try easy on something, especially when you want it so bad

12.1.20  5:31 am   I usually am the one to reach out to people to hang out and what not, so I stopped reaching out to see if anyone would reach out to me and I realized that I don't actually have any friends. How can I actually make good friends?

      i think this might be the perfect time to take a look at some of your non friend-related goals. this will help you be more of the person you want to be, which will also easily improve the friend scene in the future

12.1.20  4:53 am   how are you so blatant how do you think of random things?

     i refuse to think of random things. i only think of things in numerical order

     what goes into your mind all the time?

     it's a lot of counting

12.1.20  4:01 am   do you like christmas ?

      i was going to say no but now that i think about it yes

      flipping hecko yes

12.1.20  12:11 am   why did the chicken cross the road

      what my client (the chicken) and i are wondering is why was a road built across the chicken's path

12.1.20  12:05 am   I like to make very simple music from time to time, but sometimes I come up with a tune that I later realize is just a variation or too similar to a tune I have already created before. Do you have any advice on how to not make songs that sound too similar to one another?

      this is just an experiment, but try to write something that's not a song. it will become a song anyway, and the pathway back should be unique





PREVIOUS QUESTIONS

      music

11.30.20  9:50 pm   Out of all of the songs you have made so far, and not including something that hasn't been made yet, which is your favorite? (I think this will work).
